verses.verse: For all this I considered<WH5414> in my heart<WH3820> even to declare<WH952> all this, that the righteous<WH6662>, and the wise<WH2450>, and their works<WH5652>, are in the hand<WH3027> of God<WH430>: no man<WH120> knoweth<WH3045> either<WH1571> love<WH160> or hatred<WH8135> by all that is before<WH6440> them. I considered: Heb. I gave, or, set to my heart

All things come alike to all: there is one<WH259> event<WH4745> to the righteous<WH6662>, and to the wicked<WH7563>; to the good<WH2896> and to the clean<WH2889>, and to the unclean<WH2931>; to him that sacrificeth<WH2076>, and to him that<WH834> sacrificeth<WH2076> not: as is the good<WH2896>, so is the sinner<WH2398>; and he that sweareth<WH7650>, as he that feareth<WH3373> an oath<WH7621>.

This is an evil<WH7451> among all things that are done<WH6213> under the sun<WH8121>, that there is one<WH259> event<WH4745> unto all: yea, also the heart<WH3820> of the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> is full<WH4390> of evil<WH7451>, and madness<WH1947> is in their heart<WH3824> while they live<WH2416>, and after<WH310> that they go to the dead<WH4191>.
For<WH4310> to him that is<WH3426> joined<WH2266> <WH977> to all the living<WH2416> there is hope<WH986>: for a living<WH2416> dog<WH3611> is better<WH2896> than a dead<WH4191> lion<WH738>.

For the living<WH2416> know<WH3045> that they shall die<WH4191>: but the dead<WH4191> know<WH3045> not any thing<WH3972>, neither have they any more a reward<WH7939>; for the memory<WH2143> of them is forgotten<WH7911>.

Also their love<WH160>, and their hatred<WH8135>, and their envy<WH7068>, is now<WH3528> perished<WH6>; neither have they any more a portion<WH2506> for ever<WH5769> in any thing that is done<WH6213> under the sun<WH8121>.

Go thy way<WH3212>, eat<WH398> thy bread<WH3899> with joy<WH8057>, and drink<WH8354> thy wine<WH3196> with a merry<WH2896> heart<WH3820>; for God<WH430> now<WH3528> accepteth<WH7521> thy works<WH4639>.
Let thy garments<WH899> be always<WH6256> white<WH3836>; and let thy head<WH7218> lack<WH2637> no ointment<WH8081>.

Live<WH2416> joyfully<WH7200> with the wife<WH802> whom thou lovest<WH157> all the days<WH3117> of the life<WH2416> of thy vanity<WH1892>, which he hath given<WH5414> thee under the sun<WH8121>, all the days<WH3117> of thy vanity<WH1892>: for that is thy portion<WH2506> in this life<WH2416>, and in thy labour<WH5999> which thou takest<WH6001> under the sun<WH8121>. Live: Heb. See, or, Enjoy life

Whatsoever thy hand<WH3027> findeth<WH4672> to do<WH6213>, do<WH6213> it with thy might<WH3581>; for there is no work<WH4639>, nor device<WH2808>, nor knowledge<WH1847>, nor wisdom<WH2451>, in the grave<WH7585>, whither thou goest<WH1980>.

I returned<WH7725>, and saw<WH7200> under the sun<WH8121>, that the race<WH4793> is not to the swift<WH7031>, nor the battle<WH4421> to the strong<WH1368>, neither yet bread<WH3899> to the wise<WH2450>, nor yet riches<WH6239> to men of understanding<WH995>, nor yet favour<WH2580> to men of skill<WH3045>; but time<WH6256> and chance<WH6294> happeneth<WH7136> to them all.

For man<WH120> also knoweth<WH3045> not his time<WH6256>: as the fishes<WH1709> that are taken<WH270> in an evil<WH7451> net<WH4685>, and as the birds<WH6833> that are caught<WH270> in the snare<WH6341>; so<WH1992> are the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> snared<WH3369> in an evil<WH7451> time<WH6256>, when it falleth<WH5307> suddenly<WH6597> upon them.
This<WH2090> wisdom<WH2451> have I seen<WH7200> also under the sun<WH8121>, and it seemed great<WH1419> unto me:

There was a little<WH6996> city<WH5892>, and few<WH4592> men<WH582> within it; and there came<WH935> a great<WH1419> king<WH4428> against it, and besieged<WH5437> it, and built<WH1129> great<WH1419> bulwarks<WH4685> against it:

Now there was found<WH4672> in it a poor<WH4542> wise<WH2450> man<WH376>, and he by his wisdom<WH2451> delivered<WH4422> the city<WH5892>; yet no man<WH120> remembered<WH2142> that same poor<WH4542> man<WH376>.
Then said<WH559> I, Wisdom<WH2451> is better<WH2896> than strength<WH1369>: nevertheless the poor man's<WH4542> wisdom<WH2451> is despised<WH959>, and his words<WH1697> are not heard<WH8085>.
The words<WH1697> of wise<WH2450> men are heard<WH8085> in quiet<WH5183> more than the cry<WH2201> of him that ruleth<WH4910> among fools<WH3684>.
Wisdom<WH2451> is better<WH2896> than weapons<WH3627> of war<WH7128>: but one<WH259> sinner<WH2398> destroyeth<WH6> much<WH7235> good<WH2896>.
